meanings.definition: A form of government in which power is shared by two individuals or groups.
meanings.sent1: In some dyarchies, two leaders work together to make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The dyarchies in ancient Rome were known for their unique system of governance.
meanings.sent3: The dyarchies at the school council meeting led to some interesting debates.
meanings.sent4: The dyarchies of the business world can sometimes result in conflicting strategies.
meanings.sent5: The concept of dyarchies can be seen in various historical civilizations.

meanings.definition: The rule or dominion of two individuals or groups.
meanings.sent1: Their dyarchies over the land brought stability and prosperity to the region.
meanings.sent2: The dyarchies of the siblings often led to disagreements over household chores.
meanings.sent3: The dyarchies of the dynamic duo made them a force to be reckoned with.
meanings.sent4: The dyarchies of the forest creatures created a delicate balance in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The concept of dyarchies is prevalent in many aspects of society.
